security: Releasing information about individuals' political affiliations, arrests, and personal details (like Social Security Numbers) could lead to privacy violations and potential harm. Also, revealing FBI's sources (SF T-1, etc.) could compromise their effectiveness. The document states, 'This document contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the BI. It is the property of the FBI and is loaned to your agency; it and its contents are not to be distributed outside your agency.'
summary: This FBI report details the activities, structure, and members of the Vietnam Day Committee (VDC) in Berkeley, California, including information on individuals associated with the committee and their affiliations with various political organizations.
summary_one_paragraph: This FBI report, dated April 8, 1966, provides information on the Vietnam Day Committee (VDC) based in Berkeley, California. It outlines the VDC's headquarters, structure, steering committee members, and various protest activities, including demonstrations against Vice President Humphrey, Secretary of State Rusk, and UN Ambassador Goldberg. The report also notes assistance from the Communist Party, Socialist Workers Party, Progressive Labor Party, and W.E.B. Du Bois Clubs of America. Additionally, it details the VDC's finances and includes background information on key members, such as Anya Allister, Peter Cohen, and Jerry Rubin, with references to their political activities and arrests.
tags: W.E.B. Du Bois Clubs of America
title: VIETNAM DAY COMMITTEE
recipient: USA, San Francisco; G-2, San Francisco; DIO, San Francisco; OSI, Travis AFB
